alert.note: Alert for Clarion; Forest; Jefferson (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:58AM EST until February 19 at 3:31AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Allegheny River At Parker affecting Clarion and Armstrong Counties. Allegheny River At Rimer affecting Clarion and Armstrong Counties. Clarion River At Cooksburg affecting Jefferson PA, Clarion and Forest Counties.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC031-053-065-180400- /O.NEW.KPBZ.FL.W.0006.220218T0817Z-220219T0831Z/ /COKP1.2.ER.220218T0817Z.220218T1800Z.220219T0230Z.NO/ 1058 AM EST Thu Feb 17 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clarion River at Cooksburg. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Macbeth Cabins flood and water reaches River Road near the State Park office At 14.0 feet, About 1 foot of water covers River Road near the Cook Forest State Park office. At 17.0 feet, The basement of the Cook Forest State Park office starts flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 4.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 15.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
